snippet: Delmon Young, who police said shouted anti-Semitic slurs and attacked tourists in April, was a hitting star for the Tigers in Game 1.
abstract: Detroit Tigers designated hitter Delmon Young makes his first appearance playing in New York since his April 2012 arrest in the city on second-degree aggravated harassment after confrontation outside a New York hotel; Young's one-out double in the top of 12th helped Tigers beat New York Yankees in Game 1 of ALCS.
lead_paragraph: Delmon Young, who police said shouted anti-Semitic slurs and attacked tourists in April, was a hitting star for the Tigers in Game 1.

headline.seo: Tigers’ Delmon Young Works on Image After New York Arrest
headline.main: Tigers’ Delmon Young Moving Past His New York Arrest
